channel.title: Opening the client issues
channel.description:
when i open the client for easyrsc it says "Java JAR (the client) cannot be launched"
What have i done wrong or what can i do? I am a mac user.

item.title: Opening the client issues
item.dc:creator: @No_Effn_Lime No Effn Lime
item.description:
@No_Effn_Lime wrote:

gilbo184:

How do you use it? Lets be honest I am not a computer person.

You need to include a build.xml file in your client file. Then use the command “ant” to run it. You can even make certain tasks such as “runclient” or “jar”, in which you would write “ant runclient” or “ant jar”, respectively.

Read full topic

item.title: Opening the client issues
item.dc:creator: @gilbo184 gilbo184
item.description:
@gilbo184 wrote:

How do you use it? Lets be honest I am not a computer person.

A message like this comes up similar but a different application if you know what i mean.

Read full topic

item.title: Opening the client issues
item.dc:creator: @No_Effn_Lime No Effn Lime
item.description:
@No_Effn_Lime wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:3, topic:518428”][quote author=No Effn Lime link=topic=636692.msg4292528#msg4292528 date=1367594198]
JAR files are only “double clickable” if they are manifested. To manifest a file, there must be no lib jars, so easyrsc would not be a candidate for this… You need to make a run.command file and write a java command inside to launch the file.
[/quote]This is untrue, even though a java application contains libraries, it can still be ‘manifested’.

@OP Just use apache ant, it’s way easier.[/quote]

Yeah use apache ant, its already pre-installed on macs

Read full topic

item.title: Opening the client issues
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

java -cp EasyRSC.jar path.to.mudclient

Read full topic

item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“No Effn Lime, post:2, topic:518428”]JAR files are only “double clickable” if they are manifested. To manifest a file, there must be no lib jars, so easyrsc would not be a candidate for this… You need to make a run.command file and write a java command inside to launch the file.[/quote]This is untrue, even though a java application contains libraries, it can still be ‘manifested’.

@OP Just use apache ant, it’s way easier.

@No_Effn_Lime wrote:

JAR files are only “double clickable” if they are manifested. To manifest a file, there must be no lib jars, so easyrsc would not be a candidate for this… You need to make a run.command file and write a java command inside to launch the file.
